Footdrop treatment for everyone

Bringing freedom of mobility to those who previously could not afford it.

Find out more

An affordable FES device for footdrop treatment

Foot++ is developing an affordable Functional Electrical Stimulation (FES) device for treatment of footdrop (PENDING FDA 510K APPROVAL). We have created an accessible, affordable, and customizable FES device for footdrop as an alternative to the extremely expensive devices available on the market today.

Team

Pierluigi Mantovani

B.A. in Cognitive Science - UC Berkeley. Since graduating, Pierluigi has been doing neuroscience research at UCSF, focusing on electrical stimulation effects in the brain. Foot++ stems from his father’s battle with MS and footdrop, in which he found that an affordable FES device was nonexistent.

Pierre Karashchuk

B.A. in Computer Science and Statistics - UC Berkeley. Currently a PhD candidate in Neuroscience at University of Washington. He is interested in basic and applied neuroscience.

Peggy Wang

Pursuing B.S. in Biomechanical Engineering - Stanford. Currently working on research projects at Stanford BDML. She is especially invested in Foot++ because she herself has a slight hearing impairment, so she is committed to bringing affordable, non-intrusive medical devices to people in need.

John Naulty Jr.

B.A. in Cognitive Science - UC Berkeley. Cloud infrastructure engineer and hardware enthusiast. He is a member, and co-founder of NeurotechX, and enjoys being part of a community of curious researchers, engineers, and others interested in the intersection of neuroscience and technology.
